verbatim_example: I'm just happy to not be taking heroin anymore
Ten year on / off IV heroin user... this time it's finally taken hold. In less than 3 weeks I'll be a year clean.

I stopped all benzo/adderall use and tapered down to Kratom. I thought by today I would feel relief knowing I was only on Kratom, but I am still not clean while on Kratom and have been through 2 weeks of hell already.
now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom... makes withdrawal 10x's worse... I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago

I have dealing with this game for 2 months, I will not use for 3-4 days but would constantly relapse. ... Going outside feels so terrifying, esp when I am physically shaking and in constant cold sweats.
I thought the benzo withdrawals kicked in that first week but now that I look back I think it was primarily opiate withdrawals
recent withdrawal. I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day. The withdrawal was really intense
I'm 4 months sober and know my life is going in the positive direction. But it's so fucking hard to stay sober when I still feel so empty and just bored everyday.
I've been 4 months sober. I'm doing better now with my cravings.

I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering. Sobriety comes with real emotion, drive, initiative, charisma, some pain from the wreckage of our past, true insight, real friends who care about you and who you actually care about.
I am in the thick of wd. I cant do this
Almost five days clean . I feel great all day, but I can't handle the wrestless legs at night.
I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting, no shitting water, no puking, no seizures (from benzo wd), no sweats. The wrestless legs still won't quit.
I am scared bc I know I will want to use
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia
I am happy to be here, sober . I am starting to really mourn for ten years I lost to oxycontin and Xanax.
I was very upfront about​ my recovery
Not this year. I celebrated by not using. It was hard, so hard to actually deal with all that pain, and all of those emotions, but I made it. By the grace of God, I didn't use.
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal
Was completely transparent. Precribed 2 8mg subs a day. Took the first one last night, and got so, so high. But not like opiates high (except for the puking)
couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel
I used to run one in r/opiates
But I’m able to deal and cope with it without loading up a shot of heroin to just push those feelings away for a few hours.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed...I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out
I’m officially one year clean from opiates
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse
Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, plan on working out after work, dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed
Dropping the Lope to 4mg and possibly the same GABA/Kpin dosage
Waking up to day 7. Sleep was total shit and so is this morning. Right now feels so discouraging.

Minutes since the last opiate went into my body. One week down, working on day 8. So far I haven't been a huge crybaby like yesterday. Instead it's just a emotional void, no good or bad. I'll take that over just bad.
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass
I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently. I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day. I still can't sleep well but I'm grabbing more random spurts of it.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
Still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off. Still can't totally relax without some restless feet. Lingering anhedonia that comes in waves.
Restless in the evening, or whenever I lay down in general, but I'm sleeping 5-6.5 hours with a melatonin and unisom

16 days in the books... Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind. Sort of feels like I'm a more functional shell of myself... in a good way.

I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point. It hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay
a few cases of the clammy sweats
crazy afternoon episode of the sweats
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs
Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync compared to 27-30. Almost feels like days 7-11 again.
can't sleep. but I'm happy I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would. I have an appetite. being off dope feels so good
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain. My dad gave me a 7.5 hydrocodone.
I haven't been using for almost two months
Day. 3. At work early. Feel OK. Got lots of benzos just in case. And lope of course lol
Achy. Zero sleep. But I feel so much better than just yesterday.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way... Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore... Im still only a few days clean, but im not turning back
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least

I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly
Yet as much as we hate it, it's important to be prepared. I've seen people post their WD kits before. So what's in yours?

I've cut myself off my main supply by requesting my mother stop refilling her meds (she doesn't actually take them - I simply con her out of them) this time around. ... I bought some Kratom, and have some muscle relaxers for the withdrawl I may experience. But, truth be told - my withdrawl isn't anywhere near what I've seen in others. Bone pain and exhaustion is about it.
I'm going to take my 60 day chip today
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
But, can I share the miracle that has happened to me in recovery? ... I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit. ... This opiate habit struck me like a cancer. ... having 4 months clean
I gave in and took pain meds three times in the last week or so
Early in recovery the thoughts of using are so non-stop that it feels as if this is never going to change

I remember when I was using that if I was honest with myself, the answer was always that I wanted to change things and wanted to stop- but the next thought would be that I needed to make a plan first, and certainly couldn’t start right then, because I wanted to do it ‘right’.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication
withdrawal is very similar to the flu. I just had the thought that if someone who is on subs, methadone, or using, and has been wanting to jump off/get clean
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. I’ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use.
I've been clean for two years
Been clean two years, and the worst thing about a craving is...
I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years, haven't shot up in almost three... If I were to get a single dilaudid 8 and boot it first thing in the am
I am about 90-100 days clean. It’s the most clean time I’ve had and I seriously couldn’t be happier. ... Using everyday. It was a living hell.
I’m clean under a year and it’s so shocking to me that he used
I finally reached a year sober literally today
I've been at this particular house for a month and the only time I've been tested was the first and second day I got here
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday, my son is almost 8 weeks old, I'm gaining so much in my life and I'm actually happy, so why do I still want to get high?
I’m also currently in sober living due to my conditions of release/deferred disposition and will have just over 2 years clean when I can leave here
7/18/16 was the day I actually got sober. The 17th was the last time I had a shot of heroin.
at this point i have no tolerance anymore. Its been so long
I am on day 15 without Heroin. I am struggling atm. Depression is a big struggle and i just want to numb everything out. Im sick of the cravings.
Today is day 17 without heroin. Its been a struggle im still struggling with the mental sides of things and the depression
Im sick of feeling like crap, throwing up, being depressed

Today is the start of day 21
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free

i have been in hospital for days
Day 1 off heroin today. Really struggling with some things which r stressing me out and worrying me. ... So im very much trying to not go fuck it all and go back to heroin.

been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals
I am on day 15 off heroin
I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin
I have been in rehab for the passed 3 months. I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl. I am still getting used to being clean.
5 days clean right now, but on my 3rd attempt (longest was 17 days) since Jan., so physically feeling pretty alright
first 6 days reading about how to not feel terrible

33 days clean today, and super proud of it. I'm feeling pretty good, and every day is GETTING BETTER. I've been hitting my outpatient program super hard, 1 on 1 every Tuesday and group 3 times a week.
At that moment, nothing mattered except for recovery. I was (an still am) so exhausted with everything and everybody that had to do with my using that I was willing to do anything to be clean.

Living with my parents is alright, but I feel like it's holding me back from being independent (which I feel is an important part of recovery)
it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person

I guess I am still addicted to chaos
This wheel that I'm grateful for everyday that I don't have to be on
now that I’m clean. Today I’ve got 90 days.

So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). I'm also in a drug court probation program. My alternative sentence is 7 years w/ an 85% in state prison. So its safe to say I take my recovery very seriously.

through the worst of the physical WDs

can't sleep, and feeling really emotional... I know about the insomnia, and the RLS, and the aches, and the sweats, and the depression, and the anxiety, as this is not my first time being without the drug
on day 3 of coming off a pretty serious PST habit
I've been using PST, about 2-2.5 lbs of Seeds a day, depending on quality, for a little over a year. Every day, no tolerance breaks, just a few accidental withdrawals when FEDEX fucked up lol.

Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST. Symptoms have been managed with Lope for the first 2 days, and then nothing stronger than an ill advised couple Benadryl on day 3, and a few advil.
11 days since I quit a daily PST habit of 2 1/2 pounds a day for about 2 years
15 days clean off PST and wanted to post an update.  Insomnia is starting to fade, restlessness no where near as bad, and the bit of mania I had last week seemed to have passed
I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit of about 2 lbs a day. I have the worst headache of my life achey and chilly, when I'm not feeling on fire. My guts also are, not great.
5 weeks off a pretty heavy PST habit
coming of my longest everyday using time of 2+ years
got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years
It's like ice picks in my brain. The pain is incredible.
Crying for almost no reason. I got dizzy and nauseous and angry
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much
My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit. I'm so weak, it's been years.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine. ... I'm not really having cravings, because it just feels so. Fucking. GOOD. To be free of the goddamn weight of the pills.
My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia
I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin

I think about using sometimes, I do recognize that I am not immune to that pull. Life gets hard and I want to check out, but I don't. I remember how shit it was most of the time, how sick I got, how needy I became.
Getting off the shit was hell

Still clean as a whistle. I went to the pharmacy today and they had just gotten a shipment of painkillers... interesting test, talking to someone about my script while a large quantity of opiates was six inches from me.

Last year I checked myself into rehab for the 2nd time, almost a year exact from the first time I went to rehab... My first month or 2 out of rehab I opened up Google Calendar and I scheduled every single thing I was going to be doing for the week, and I stuck to it... I did meetings a lot in the beginning, did a 90 in 90 and I slowly faded after that
I have two years sober today
I got sober in 2014. A year later we reconnected. I helped get him County funding to get into rehab.

3 years ago today would be the first day in rehab that I didn't take a suboxone and was fully off any type of narcotic. I had ruined a lot of relationships and was on the brink of losing my job. I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety.
Yesterday was my 4 years sober. I used to be one of those people who thought the dopamine levels in their brain would never be fixed and I was doomed to keep using in order to be happy.

since i recently quit heroin my tolerance is pretty low

Day 5 and I feel so much better even though yesterday wasn't that bad
I'm over the worst why go right back. I'm just feeling trapped and depressed. I have been at the house for the 5th day now. But another day sober.
Fought for sleep last night. No aches or anything like that just my brain could out run usain bolt

crawling my ass out of bed is easier
I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life

Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.
My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
I am now 23 and feel like I need to get it right this time; I know I do not want to pick up

sober now and decided to take my dog to the lake... I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days

On day 7!!!!!, in the next 12 hours or so I will oficially have a week clean. The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep, only got 3 hours of sleep last night.
the terrible withdraws that come with quitting

I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy. But my state of mind is in the trash.
Day 4 here. Having another good day. This is my first sober weekend
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011
It's day 20 for me. Tomorrow will be 3 weeks sober, which is incredible to me. This is already the most real clean time I've ever had without using illicit substances.
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah!
I know I can stay sober one more day
But, I am clean, and life is good! Weather you're just starting off, restarting, or you have years of clean time, stay clean just for today.

Had a minor drug dream last night so I got up a bit earlier than usual this morning but I didn't let it bring me down like I usually would! Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt

I have decided to go. All my friends know I am in recovery and will not be drinking with them. I feel like this will be a good test. Being so far away, reconnecting with old friends. Luckily the handful of people I used with in Florida will not be there
I've now officially moved from the rehabilitation phase, to the aftercare phase. I am in such a better place, but since I was in such bad shape my program will be easing my transition.
even if you just have the desire to stop using

Been trying to pick up on hobbies like sneakers, movies, working on my car, etc. Shits been going pretty well. I have good days and bad days. Been in a bit of a funk since right around my 90 days clean. Having extremely vivid bad dreams, or drug dreams, 4/7 night a week.

It's day 110 for me since I last used opiates, marijuana, alcohol, coca in, etc. I've gotten out of little 90 day funk finally! Just been doing lots of meetings, therapy, step work, and hanging out with new as well as old friends.

I finally asked for help and started being honest. Honest with my family, with my friends, with my therapist, and most importantly with myself. It was the first time that I truly accepted that I was indeed an addict, and that I couldn't do it by myself.
I haven't done opiates in 10 months and I still fantasize about doing dope constantly
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years
shivering on Christmas day, as I am trying to be strong and endure moving from chewing a 50mcg fentynal patch every day to oxycontin (20mg)

I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry and broke... taking the sub last night will likely leave me with only minor WDs today, but tomorrow will be the worst if my package doesn't arrive
I'm so tired of constantly dealing with moderate to severe withdrawals
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free
I'm on day 14 now. Every day is a little but better but also a little bit harder. I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
Days 18, 19, and 20 were pretty good. Slept better those previous night. Last night was rough. No sleeping aids beyond melatonin. I have zopiclone but not super keen on that.
Smoked a roach I had in my ash tray on Friday night and felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC
Slept the first 12 hours. Unable to keep any food or even water down. Feeling really angry at myself and pretty hopeless right now.

three hours after my last dose, negative 800 in my account, no credit, nothing to my name anymore. The desperation. The insanity. The panic.

as an addict in early recovery (Feb. 22)

Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point. I'm just trying to not let myself leave the house right now. Minute by minute. I want to be free so bad and I know the only way to do that is to be strong and abstain. But my brain is playing tricks saying just go cop a tiny bit to get you through and no more...

withdrawal symptoms i get when i wake up in the morning are a bit worse than i'd have from the suboxone

so today is day 1...again. The depression has left me crippled, I don't know what  to do about it. I have some sub's I can take
